Question
===================
If the following probability distribution is valid, what is P(X=4)?
Please give your answers to 2 decimal places. 
```{r showtable, echo=FALSE}
pmf
```




Solution
========
For a probability distribution to be valid, all of the probabilities must sum to 1. Therefore, calculate $$1- P(k=1)- P(k=2) - P(k=3)$$ to find P(X = 4), which rounded to 2 decimal places is `r sol`
